verses.kjv: Then he brought me forth into the utter court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that was over against the separate place, and which was before the building toward the north.
verses.ct: Then he led me out into the outer court, going north, and brought me to the room that was across from the restricted area and across from the building on the north side.

verses.kjv: Before the length of an hundred cubits was the north door, and the breadth was fifty cubits.
verses.ct: Along the north entrance, the structure was 150 feet long and 75 feet wide.

verses.kjv: Over against the twenty cubits which were for the inner court, and over against the pavement which was for the utter court, was gallery against gallery in three stories.
verses.ct: Facing the 30-foot section belonging to the inner court, and facing the pavement of the outer court, the structure had gallery facing gallery on 3 levels.

verses.kjv: And before the chambers was a walk of ten cubits breadth inward, a way of one cubit; and their doors toward the north.
verses.ct: In front of the rooms was a walkway 15 feet wide on the inner side, with a passage 18 inches wide, and their doors opened to the north.

verses.kjv: Now the upper chambers were shorter: for the galleries were higher than these, than the lower, and than the middlemost of the building.
verses.ct: The upper rooms were narrower, because the galleries took up more space from them than from the lower and middle levels of the building.

verses.kjv: For they were in three stories, but had not pillars as the pillars of the courts: therefore the building was straitened more than the lowest and the middlemost from the ground.
verses.ct: The rooms were on 3 levels but did not have pillars like the pillars of the courts. So the upper level was set back more than the lower and middle levels from the ground up.

verses.kjv: And the wall that was without over against the chambers, toward the utter court on the forepart of the chambers, the length thereof was fifty cubits.
verses.ct: The outer wall that ran parallel to the rooms on the outer court side, in front of the rooms, was 75 feet long.

verses.kjv: For the length of the chambers that were in the utter court was fifty cubits: and, lo, before the temple were an hundred cubits.
verses.ct: The row of rooms along the outer court was 75 feet long, while the row facing the temple was 150 feet long.

verses.kjv: And from under these chambers was the entry on the east side, as one goeth into them from the utter court.
verses.ct: Below these rooms there was an entrance on the east side for those coming in from the outer court.

verses.kjv: The chambers were in the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, over against the separate place, and over against the building.
verses.ct: On the south side along the width of the court wall, facing the restricted area and facing the building, there were also rooms.

verses.kjv: And the way before them was like the appearance of the chambers which were toward the north, as long as they, and as broad as they: and all their goings out were both according to their fashions, and according to their doors.
verses.ct: The passageway in front of them looked just like the one by the northern rooms. They were the same length and width, and all their exits matched in both design and doorways.

verses.kjv: And according to the doors of the chambers that were toward the south was a door in the head of the way, even the way directly before the wall toward the east, as one entereth into them.
verses.ct: Matching the doors of the southern rooms, there was a door at the beginning of the passageway — the passageway running directly along the wall to the east — which people used to enter them.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they be holy chambers, where the priests that approach unto the LORD shall eat the most holy things: there shall they lay the most holy things, and the meat offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.
verses.ct: Then he told me, "The northern rooms and the southern rooms facing the restricted area are holy rooms where the priests who serve the LORD will eat the most holy offerings. That is where they will place the most holy offerings, the grain offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering, because the area is holy."

verses.kjv: When the priests enter therein, then shall they not go out of the holy place into the utter court, but there they shall lay their garments wherein they minister; for they are holy; and shall put on other garments, and shall approach to those things which are for the people.
verses.ct: "When the priests enter these rooms, they must not go back out into the outer court without first removing the garments they wore while serving, because those garments are holy. They must change into other clothes before going near the areas open to the people."

verses.kjv: Now when he had made an end of measuring the inner house, he brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect is toward the east, and measured it round about.
verses.ct: When he finished measuring the interior of the temple complex, he led me out through the gate facing east and measured all around the outside.

verses.kjv: He measured the east side with the measuring reed, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
verses.ct: He measured the east side with his measuring rod — 500 rods by the measuring rod all the way around.

verses.kjv: He measured the north side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
verses.ct: He measured the north side — 500 rods by the measuring rod all the way around.

verses.kjv: He measured the south side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed.
verses.ct: He measured the south side — 500 rods by the measuring rod.

verses.kjv: He turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
verses.ct: He turned to the west side and measured 500 rods with the measuring rod.

verses.kjv: He measured it by the four sides: it had a wall round about, five hundred reeds long, and five hundred broad, to make a separation between the sanctuary and the profane place.
verses.ct: He measured all 4 sides. A wall surrounded the entire area, 500 rods long and 500 rods wide, creating a boundary between what was holy and what was common.
